Field Detail

p_access

private static PermissionAccess p_access
Class attribute as static in the Singleton Pattern so only one instance is loaded at one time.

Constructor Detail

PermissionAccess

private PermissionAccess()
Empty Constructor

Method Detail

getAccess

public static PermissionAccess getAccess()
Using a singleton pattern to return an access object that restricts the saving and application of Permissions to users. Most setting of permissions requires in itself a permission object. (one should always be included in the database when application is run)

Returns:
PermissionAccecss object

getRootLevel

protected Permissions getRootLevel()
Permissions level default 0 is returned. Similar to getDefault, but that method returns a PermissionLevel object using this Permissions object.

Returns:
Permission object of the most basic level

getDefault

protected PermissionLevel getDefault()
Returns the lowest-level default permission level to the user

Returns:
PermissionLevel default level

getLevel

protected PermissionLevel getLevel(int level,
                                   char version)
Returns a PermissionLevel object with a null Permissions object inside, generally for searching via PermissionBroker or setting up new permission levels.

Parameters:
level - int level
version - char version
Returns:
PermissionLevel with level and version.

setPermissions

protected PermissionLevel setPermissions(Permissions p,
                                         PermissionLevel pl)
                                  throws InvalidPermissionException
Will return a copy of the permissions level if and only if the Permissions is null. Does not modify the original copy.

Parameters:
p - Permissions to set the PermissionLevel to.
pl - PermissionLevel that is to be modified
Returns:
PermissionLevel with permissions in it.
Throws:
InvalidPermissionException

getCustomPermission

protected Permissions getCustomPermission(boolean canEditSched,
                                          boolean canReadSched,
                                          boolean canReadOldSched,
                                          boolean canManageEmployee,
                                          boolean canViewResources,
                                          boolean canChangePermissions,
                                          boolean canReadLogs,
                                          boolean canAccessReports,
                                          boolean canRequestDaysOff,
                                          int maxDaysOff,
                                          boolean canTakeVacations,
                                          int maxVacationDays,
                                          boolean canTakeEmergencyDays,
                                          boolean canViewInactiveEmps,
                                          boolean canSendNotifications,
                                          int trustedLevel)
Method to generate a Permissions object that is returned. It is just a copy and has no bearing on the system itself, unless either saved to a permission level or used in searching for relevant permission levels in the database.

Parameters:
canEditSched -
canReadSched -
canReadOldSched -
canManageEmployee -
canViewResources -
canChangePermissions -
canReadLogs -
canAccessReports -
canRequestDaysOff -
maxDaysOff -
canTakeVacations -
maxVacationDays -
canTakeEmergencyDays -
canViewInactiveEmps -
canSendNotifications -
trustedLevel -
Returns:
Permissions object with assigned permissions.

createPermissionLevel

public boolean createPermissionLevel(PermissionLevel create,
                                     Employee creator)
                              throws DBException,
                                     DBDownException,
                                     InvalidPermissionException,
                                     PermissionViolationException
Method that limits access to Permission resources, but allows a user (creator variable) to create a Permission Level as specified by the create variable.

Parameters:
PermissionLevel - create - Level to create
Employee - creator - Employee requesting creation of Permissionlevel
Returns:
boolean true if created successfully
Throws:
DBException
InvalidPermissionException - if user does not have permission to create permission level
PermissionViolationException
DBDownException

deletePermissionLevel

public boolean deletePermissionLevel(PermissionLevel delete,
                                     Employee requester)
                              throws InvalidPermissionException,
                                     DBDownException,
                                     DBException,
                                     PermissionViolationException
Deletes a permission level, redirects the request to the package PermissionBroker which cannot be directly accessed. Security is the reason why it's not public in that class.

Parameters:
delete -
requester -
Returns:
boolean true if successful
Throws:
InvalidPermissionException
DBException
PermissionViolationException
DBDownException

updatePermissionLevel

public boolean updatePermissionLevel(PermissionLevel old,
                                     PermissionLevel update,
                                     Employee requester)
                              throws InvalidPermissionException,
                                     DBException,
                                     DBDownException,
                                     PermissionViolationException
Updates a PermissionLevel object, redirects the request to the package PermissionBroker. Requires an old and new PermissionLevel object.

Parameters:
old -
update -
requester -
Returns:
Throws:
InvalidPermissionException
DBException
DBDownException
PermissionViolationException
